column4: is it possible to get back to the actual Gnome look ('ubuntu-classic' another words) in 11.10 ?
I thought it was taking out in 11.10 ?
I don't think its removed, but I may be wrong.

I think I'll check it out in a virtual machine first.  Then if I can't figure anything I'll go with Xubuntu or something more resonable than unity before I go ahead and do the partitions and dual boot .
you could boot from livecd also (rather than VM), but same difference.
I'm just trying to ween myself off of XP before 2014.. and thought I might as well anyway since it's so old.
yeah lol.  I'm just wondering if this machine would be better running a 'smaller' one ?  (like xubuntu anyway)
Ubuntu today requires some decent hardware.  Lubuntu is the lightest weight of them all, Xubuntu would be next.
E2160 should be decent enough? Yet the CelronD single core in the living room seems faster sometimes :/
thats a decent enough proc for sure.
Has ubuntu gotten any worse since hardy? in terms of needing processor/GPU power ? I was running that before I started getting in to PC gaming.
depends on your definition of worseu
I guess the only thing to do is to try it..
